_description: Verses on the reign and death of King Harold (acephalous) — last two lines of a rhyme royal stanza plus one complete stanza

BLCottJulBXII.Transcription:
…to his regne came& lieth buried In þe Abbey of
                    Walthomnow for þis matter Above In wryttyngbeyng correctible Att
                    your listeItt ys nott fformyde by crafty baladisingto opyne who made
                    itt I desisteBesechyng In fauour yow rederys to Assisteof whatt
                    condicion ye be or Astatesithe of þe makyng knew nott poet
                    lidgate
BLCottJulBXII.Note: Fragment. Folio number reflects the most recent foliation.
BLCottJulBXII.Editions:
Reimer,  Stephen R. 
             “A Fragment in Imitation of Lydgate’s ‘Verses on the Kings
                of England’.” 
             Notes and Queries
         45 [243] (1998): 426-30: 428-9.
